ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] Re: KOS?
ygData.msgSnippet: In my opinion, I know what opinions are like, if you wait for your second half you are going to be a bit disappointed. A lot of stuff will start to turn green.
ygData.messageBody:
In my opinion, I know what opinions are like, if you wait for your second
half you are going to be a bit disappointed. A lot of stuff will start to
turn green. Lvl 14 is perfect time to do this zone. You just got that
great VS Summoned spell (low mana high dmg) and this zone is FULL of
summoned mobs. Just remember if you are the meleeing type dont forget to
dispel the Lava Elementals and Imps they have a nasty fire shield.

Hope this helps, and good luck.

Mu

PS Honestly the water is a moot point, its not a big deal at all. If your
invis drops on the bridge you could have some trouble.

-----Original Message-----
From: MLockridge01@... [mailto:MLockridge01@...]
Sent: Friday, May 25, 2001 10:52 AM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [EverQuest] Re: KOS?


I haven't made that run yet. I plan to sow and camo, then run the
road. Since the bridge is the safest way to cross the water, I will
use that. Alternately, sow, levitate, then camo. Might be able to lev
over the water along the left wall.

I figured it must be a not particularly safe place when I found
groups resting just outside the zone. They seemed to be hunting just
inside, then zoning to med and rest.

Per advice here, I am thinking on working on Lavastorm for some
leveling in the second half of my teens.

Barto of Rivervale, lvl 14 halfling druid.

--- In EverQuest@y..., "Legleiter" <RETIELGEL@p...> wrote:
> Will a Halfling Druid be KOS in Nektulos Forest?
